output: Katie, you don't know, do you?
She eloped and registered their marriage with Xiaohong.
Ah, Xiaohong.
Exactly so.
You are unaware of this matter.

Regarding last time, they weren’t having a birthday, and you brought something, but I didn’t bring my KT [plush toy]. Then we got to know each other, and we had a meal together, just the two of us. I’m not really sure how we started seeing each other.
Indeed.

I don't know, and I don't remember if it was Katie who sent me a photo that day. When I saw it, I thought it was a permit—a marriage certificate. I really thought it was an approval. But then I looked more closely and realized it was a real couple, they had genuinely registered their marriage. They had chosen each other.
Considering that you didn't bring anyone, the conditions are quite favorable. Even a K-level individual finds them appealing, and the two of them have a good rapport; the chemistry is also right.
If you're not going to be helpful, don't look at me while I explain how someone else's appearance genuinely suits them; examine it closely.
It’s not quite a perfect match, but it’s actually quite suitable. Let's just wish them well.
Oh dear, it’s been a long while since we’ve been in contact. How has he been recently?
They registered their marriage.
Impossible. How could this be? How could they be ten years apart? How could they possibly be together?
Oh, it was that day.
They were at it again.
I find this utterly unbelievable. Who is pursuing whom?
The age difference is acceptable here, his parents are willing.
Oh dear, you're saying… truly? Love doesn't recognize age.
What's wrong with them? Their personalities don't match either.
Oh, blessings, blessings.
They, well, I... I... I'm embarrassed to say it. Let's just meet separately now.
You don't know, do you?
Silently departed.

Regarding the couple who quietly married when we were unaware—whether it was a quiet affair unknown to us, or one I quietly knew—they have now separated, and I've quietly learned of it; I also heard it from others.

Oh, how would I know? Perhaps at that moment, KT seemed to think the price adjustment was good, only to realize after a long time that the two of them just didn't click, their personalities weren't compatible—it should be that.
I do not know either.
It's not primarily about what kind of time it was, right? You didn’t say you felt they weren’t a good match? I also thought they were quite a suitable pair. Now you see, you were wrong.
I thought you were trying to play matchmaker, weren't you?
I thought that matchmaker was you, I really thought it was you. But they already knew each other; they were together at the time.
Ah, I see. In that case, let’s not eat with them. Let’s arrange a separate meeting. I’ll inquire and assess the situation.
Oh well, never mind.
Look, why don't we reach out to K.D. and his wife these days and arrange a meal for all of us together?
It's not that you and he don't have a good relationship. Give me a call, and I'll arrange it; I'll treat you.
What is the matter?
What's up?
Not this. How long has it even been since they got married? It’s barely any time at all.
It’s not that your marriage is about to end so quickly—what's the reason?
If our eyes don't meet, if there's no spark, why even consider marriage then?
There must be a reason for this.
You see, at that time, I felt that with their age difference, they definitely wouldn’t have a successful outcome. I genuinely didn't expect it, but they had only been married for just over a month.
I said, I said, about someone—what did they do? Their ages were mismatched, a difference of over ten years. They got married, and divorced after just over a month.
Who knows? You and he have a good relationship, don't I ask you everything?
Let's not schedule individual meetings; let's do it together.
It wasn't me, Xiaohong. I didn't say to choose a place closer to the subway. This is three kilometers from the subway – it's inconvenient for my commute.
It's not you, it's the rising sun. Look at how large other people's windows are. Look, your window is just this small. I’ll just put in a little peep hole to watch the rising sun.

It’s not, this isn’t a rigid requirement, is it? I just want to live somewhere a little better. Look at this wallpaper, it's all messed up. And there's the five-spice smell. Can’t you find me some other apartments?
You see, speaking like that is wrong. I came here, spending money, to ask for your help. You—don’t go looking for a car.

It's not that I’m saying this money definitely secures a good place, but please find something for me. There are so many options in the vicinity, and you insist on this community—do you not possess sufficient capability? Just find this house for me.
Can't you smell it? That strong odor of chemicals is already rushing in like this. I can't come in without getting sick. Who will be responsible if I do?
Let's have us sign a contract: I’ll be responsible for your lifelong care, and you will cover the expenses for treatment.
Alright, alright. I see your capabilities are just like this. Forget it. Really.
Oh, look at this room; it’s just a room that was recently vacated over here.

It's not that, it's mainly that housing is particularly tight now. Having this room is quite good, you see? The environment is very nice. And the window faces the sun – does this meet your requirements?
A window is all that's needed; you live alone, after all, it's not as if it's anything significant.
And look, the bathroom has everything a room should, including a washing machine and refrigerator. It’s fully equipped – a refrigerator, as you can see.
It's not that I’m telling you this to complain, but if I were to introduce these few clients to you every month, I’d get annoyed myself, you know?
You said there were deals, so I found some for you. You said they were hard to come by, but now you're saying this isn't good enough, and that isn't good enough. You're just finding fault.
If you continue to speak like this, you'll be fortunate to even have this house to live in.

But look, I've found you a place near the subway, a place near the subway. You say the cost is high, and it's not suitable for you. Let me find you one a little further out then, but you find that unacceptable. How about a newly renovated apartment with fresh wall coverings?

Don't tell me this. It’s just that when I scraped it, the white one hadn’t developed any flavor yet. You’re asking too much, you know? You’re really… I won't accept this. I won’t rent it. I won’t rent it.
The young and robust Gang has come to take a look and see how things are.
Ah, is that not possible?
You seem to thrive in the morning sun.
It wasn't until we were having a perfectly good discussion online just now that you said to come over to rent, and now you’re starting to find fault. What is this?
The earth grew long.
You should arrange for someone to clean it for me beforehand. Just take a look and see if you like the layout. You talk so much, really...
It wasn't I, the one currently here, who designed the room for that guest. If you can't do it, I'll repaint it white. If you want it black, I’ll repaint it black.
How wonderful! Ten years without a visit. Look at this sign.
Xiao Gang, I've noticed you're always getting involved in everything. Let's just talk online, discuss things online. I’ve realized this isn't my concern.
Oh, it’s quite pleasant to listen to.
These are all antiques in my home. You're disparaging my antiques? You mustn't exchange them. You already agreed. If you’re staying here, you have to use the things in my home.
Regarding this faucet that's constantly gushing, you should really try it yourself.

Let me put it this way: this entire building now belongs to me. Look at this key I have. I possess this entire set of keys, but only this one unit is offered at a suitable price. You can rent it or not; it's up to you. Never mind if you don't.
Then, go quickly. This is what one says when speaking. This is.
It is not simply this house.
I said to the landlady, "You see, you see this window…"
Chao Yang is too small. As a man, I have some hobbies, and there isn’t proper ventilation here.
Very well, you go on. What do you think about the Ding family?
There's still something you should see—this point here. No one lives here. As soon as you enter the room, there's this... a single roll, a single rush—it’s difficult to describe, that kind of smell.

It's not that I'm speaking, but my initial feeling is that it’s not good. Look at this wall—this side is white, and that side is black. You said when you scraped it, you had someone scrape it to a cloud-like sheen.
I’m not saying, sister, you think this refrigerator is ten years old, right?
Although it's a famous brand, look at the flavor here—it’s simply not aesthetically pleasing.
This isn't about me creating trouble; look at the washing machine.
How can this be used when it’s all rusted?

Take it and use it, your things. I said I know this can’t be used. Oh dear, I’m just staring, just looking at this thing. I said, eating won’t work, can't be used. A bath? Let’s have a bath then. This place…
Your water dragon, I can no longer wash it; chatting while washing, look, the fish head – who cares if it has a fish head or not?

I believe I deserve it. Truly, older sister, please find me a place where the expenses are roughly within my ability to manage, and the environment is at least pleasant, with good air quality and a favorable setting.
Alright, alright, I won't rent. I won't rent.
What’s wrong with thirty? Isn’t it normal to have a relationship at thirty? Aren’t you, Dad, saying I’m too old? What’s wrong with me being single at thirty? Isn’t that fine?
Not, not. Dad, you raised me; you chose to support me. If you have the ability, don't raise me, then. It's not that I think...

Your age has nothing to do with me. You support me, isn't it because you want to? I am thirty, and I am doing fine on my own. You say I should find someone who loves me, but what if I find someone who doesn't? Will you be responsible? Will you find someone for me?
It's not that I like him; what if he doesn't like me? I haven't never liked anyone before. It’s not that I look down on others; it's just that he isn't suitable for me. Don't say that to me.
Alas, I simply don't want to be in a romantic relationship; I’ve accumulated cotton through that instead. It's not as if one can’t earn money without romantic relationships.
It's alright, Dad. My current salary is enough to support you. It’s good for the two of us, father and daughter, to spend more time together, right? It’s fine, it’s no problem at all.
You just say you feel that if I were to find a partner, we wouldn’t be able to live together, and you ask how I would support you in old age. We're both single now, aren't we? Isn't this good?
I didn't get upset. It's you who feels you're upset with me. Who's the one bearing the resentment? Truly, it’s me.
You say you're in your early thirties, and I just want to ask you when you'll be able to start dating.

It’s been quite good for me to be alone these many years. After your mother passed, I was alone, providing for your every need – food, drink, hygiene, and everything else – and raising you single-handedly.
I just hope my daughter, I just hope you can find a man whom you love and who loves you. Oh, Dad, please, can you find a partner?
I am getting older.
Wouldn’t you find one you like?
Don’t give me that nonsense. If you don't want to be in a relationship, then don't be. Are you going to date cotton instead?
In your early thirties, daughter, if you don’t start dating soon, do you expect your father to support you for the rest of your life?
I truly tell you, having a daughter like you can genuinely infuriate me.
Alright, this is my final deadline: you must bring me a son-in-law and have him return home this year.
Dad, you were looking at my phone.
I don't care about this. My phone—I already told you not to look at it anymore. I'm practically an adult now. I have my own privacy. How old are you?

My thoughts weren't focused on studying? Now I'm in the top ten of the entire grade, and I haven’t let you down, have I? What exactly am I doing now? I don't need you to inquire about it. It's pointless, absolutely pointless. Now, I only want you to focus on your studies.

I feel you have no right to interfere with what I do, I'm quite grown up now. If you insist on this, I have nothing to say. Next time, don’t even look at my phone, and I won't allow you to discover any of the conversations within it.
I’m not worried about your father acting first.
I'm not upset that it's you; I'm telling you that you should feel this way.
On what grounds is confiscation justified?

It wasn’t you who told me when you bought this phone that I would manage and use it myself. Now that you're taking it, who will I contact when I’m at school? How will I reach you when I get home? What if I lose it?
When did you ever think I was rushing into romance? Just because of those two characters, you think I’m rushing into romance?
What's wrong with me being sixteen? I'm quite grown up, aren't I?
I said I was in a relationship, didn’t I? I didn’t say I was in a relationship, did I? It's you who thinks I'm in a relationship.
It's not that we, the younger generation, speak this way now. If you can’t adapt, don't adapt. We will speak this way.
What do you mean, if your father is capable, hit me then?
Please explain to me who this boy is that I've been chatting with on my phone.
Am I your father, and am I not allowed to see? I'm asking you, are you dating?
How old are you? Eighteen? You're an adult. Let me tell you, in our rural area, if you're a boy, when you start dating, your father can still manage.
Don't forget you're a girl, you know? You're a girl. You've fallen in love in high school so early. My dear, you're in high school—aren’t you going to focus on your studies?
You are being overly sentimental.
Are you deliberately trying to provoke me?
I'm telling you, you should feel this way: your phone will be confiscated starting today.
On what grounds? On what grounds? I am your father.
It is early romance, understand? It is early romance; your thoughts are not focused on your studies.
Sixteen-year-old daughter, you are only sixteen this year.
Begin a romantic relationship now.
The chat records are so pathetic. Where are you all? Are you elementary school students? Where did you learn this behavior at such a young age?
If you say that again, I will slap you.
I have nothing more to say to you. Let's talk about it again when your mother returns.
What do you mean by "爸"? Please explain. I understand everything else.
Auntie Xiaohong—I call her Auntie, as I’m the same age as you—asks that I call her Auntie, a subordinate.
Alright, you don't need to mention Aunt Xiaohong to me. Just call her Xiaohong. I appreciate it, Dad. I really can’t stand it.
When you say marriage, Dad, you should have said dating. I would have just let it pass, turning a blind eye. But now you're telling me marriage? What do you mean?
That is my husband, Wang Yisun.
I haven't received a call from Xiaohong either. We haven't been in contact at all. Then, why don't you call Xiaohong over?
Stop it. She married him. Aunt Xiaohong has become my mother. Am I calling Mom Xiaohong?
Do you think this is alright? Can you handle it yourself? I'm about the same age as Xiaohong, and then I call you "mother"—doesn't that hurt you?

What’s wrong, Xiaohong? Don't, don't, don't let me call you Mom. Absolutely don't let me call you Mom. This… this is it, then? You're going to court her? I won't say anything, but you marrying her? Let me tell you, there's no way.
Do you know why there's no way? If he wants to marry her, he’ll divide assets with me.
I am an only child, and you need to add his name to the household registration. I tell you, I sever all ties with you as a father and daughter. I tell you.
If he makes you enter my home, I will absolutely sever ties with you, and I’m not kidding.
Just don't let this Xiaohong, Xiaohong's mother, or Aunt Xiaohong cause any trouble. I'm telling you, just let her leave. Just don't let me find out, don't let me see her.
It's not your father. It's been over a year since I introduced you to Aunt Xiaohong.
You know very well the relationship between me and your Aunt Xiaohong.
It’s not that you disagree with me, but rather you disapprove of this marriage arrangement between us, isn't it?
You haven't been raised for nothing, Dad. I've been a burden to you, enduring hardship to bring you into the world. After your mother and I separated, has she ever called you?
It doesn’t matter, I’ve bought you things, haven’t I? It was all your father.
I and Xiaohong are about to get married. I'm discussing this with you now. As long as you agree, Xiaohong will be your stepmother, and I will absolutely dote on you as Xiaohong will too.
You are saying to sever the father-daughter relationship?
It infuriates me.
What is it?
I believe I understand what has happened.
Just say it directly; don't beat around the bush with me here.

Auntie Lanlan used to be my best friend, so should I call her Auntie now? If you two were to get married, I'd have to call her Mom! What are you implying? Dad, do I still have a daughter's place in this family?
It's not about whether that Lanzi has brainwashed you or not, but you came to our house for just one day and already took a liking to him.
I said he knew why he insisted on coming to my house – it’s because he’ll never be satisfied until you start earning some money; he’ll just keep demanding more.

I've finally seen through him, Dad. You don't need to say anything anymore. This Lanlan’s intentions are not pure. You should quickly ask him to leave. I tell you, if he ever truly enters our home, I won’t claim a single cent of the property.
Then you, alone, you, you alone, you seek others. Why do you want to seek out Lanlan? I do not understand how Lanlan came to be…
More than a year, Dad.

It's not Dad, either. I only called him six months ago. 
So, you two were already together before? 
I don't know if I can do this.
Dad, if you let her into our house for even one day, I will sever all ties with you as your daughter.
Look and see slowly, Dad. Anyway, things are like this now—with him, without me; without him, with me. You figure it out yourself.
Mother, I want to discuss something with you.
Isn't it possible to bring a smile to Dad's face, even if it's not you?
Just say it directly.
I intend to give this to Aunt Lan Lan so she can discuss it with you and obtain your permission for the two of us.
It’s not that I am asking, are you my father?
No, it’s not like that. Let me tell you, your sister—you know this—after your mother and I separated, your father has been alone ever since.
I and Lanlan, what has happened with me and Lanlan? What is happening with me and Lanlan now? We two have already developed a relationship for over a year, so what’s the matter?
I will give you, Lan Lan Lan Lan Lan, Auntie. You should call me Auntie in the future, call me Auntie.
Do you understand now?
What does transforming into a father-daughter relationship entail?
What should one study?
What am I doing now, Master?
It’s not that I haven’t studied diligently; how could you, my master, have noticed? It's because the problems are difficult. You even praised me previously, didn’t you?
You say I’m sculpted well, and then I’ll tell you.
No, no, Dad, no, no, no. Master, look, I already feel like you’re almost just like my father. Stinkier even than my father, you know?

Well, I've been learning this craft all along. Haven't you noticed we can't sell anything? If we can't sell anything, what does that mean? It means we can't make money. If we can't make money, what have I been carving? I’ve been carving this. I'm starting to carve some innovative pieces now, and you're saying I'm wrong again.
However, customers generally find this innovative product quite good.
I am teaching you in this way.
But it’s selling well, isn’t it? You’re making money, aren’t you? You can’t even afford the rent. Why should I let you?

It’s not your master I'm questioning, it’s you. This old thinking of yours! How many carvings of yours can you actually sell now? Tell me, did you sell even one last month? Do your carvings sell? Did you sell nine out of ten I carved this month?

If you still cling to this outdated mindset and won’t adapt, how can that be? My ability to sell these pieces demonstrates the utility of our innovations. These carvings possess meaning; their significance is evident. If they wish to purchase, we can rent a larger space for the shop.
They would only buy your carved work if they truly valued my face; why would they buy mine? Because they can use me as a gift, but yours they cannot.
Not a master.
I still have.
No Master.
I apologize to you, Master.
You say you carry around a broken handheld level every day, what are you arranging? Have you learned this carving technique or not?
Did you study?
You are so young, yet you spend your days playing on your phone, neglecting the skills I've taught you. Have you truly applied yourself to learning them? Have you?
I praise you; that is me praising you.
Let me tell you, you're so young, everything I've taught you is from my own youth. When I was young, many people sought me out for things.
You are now sitting here like a venerable elder.
Are you here to learn a trade from me, or are you here to act the master?
What are you carving?

Is this how I taught you?
Was this how I taught you?
Let me tell you, I’m watching your father – we’re good friends. I'm teaching you, but if you continue like this, go home and act like a young master.
Acting as if you are my master, I will not accept you as my apprentice.
Those you've sold to are all your classmates and friends; they're doing it out of face-saving, you understand? Just take a look at yourself and see what you really are.
Do you feel, inherently, that you are currently well-fed and comfortable?
You dare shout at your master? Your Highness, you've only just learned to walk, and now you wish to fly?
Is that Xiaofei?
Alright, tomorrow return home and be your Shaolin. I will no longer accept you as my disciple.
Just now, brother, look over there, a glass walkway. Let’s go that way.

It's not that this can't be sold. It’s not like I paid you to come here. Last time, I asked you for such a huge favor, and I said I’d take you here to have some really fun, really thrilling experiences. Didn't you agree to that? Look how good it is. Come on, try this one.
It’s not that you look down—looking down relaxes you, and it’s quite stimulating, isn’t it? Look, look, the little animals are greeting you. Look, tilt your head down a bit.
You, take it slow, it's truly alright, it's fine. There’s no need to be anxious watching like this.
Come, let me pull you. Come, let me pull you.
Not to come.
Just take a step, don't look down. Otherwise, look at me, fix your gaze on me. Yes, come forward, take the first step. Step one, two, slowly. Stop, stop.

Are you alright? You’ve already got one foot up, right? Bring up the second foot and let’s move forward, one, two. Don’t look down. How did you end up kneeling? No, no, no, stop fussing. Get up, get up.

It's alright, look at me, let’s walk across. We can’t go back, do you understand? Brother Gang, we can’t go back now at all. Once you’re on this trestle, we won’t be able to return. We can only proceed after we’ve passed this point, so don’t be afraid.

If you come to see me, you run after me; let’s go forward, one, two; look ahead, one, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two, two.
This this this this this this
Let’s return the tickets, shall we? I cannot sell these here.
Don't move me, don't move me.
I can’t. My legs are weak.
No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.
No, no, no. You're going to return the tickets, aren't you? I’m not playing anymore. It’s not possible.
You're saying this isn't trying to take my life, right? I… I… I can't move my legs.
Just what does this mean?
Just now, just now, just now—you, you, you aren’t joking, right? No, no, don’t tie me up, don’t tie me up. I haven’t agreed yet, haven’t agreed yet.
It's not that I didn't sign a contract; I didn't sign a contract, no, no, no. Could you possibly...
It wasn’t just that I was terrified, I really was terrified, I was terrified. Don’t continue.
This is certainly not something to look forward to.
Give me water pressure, I'll push you. Put you down. Don't push me. Don't push with my brother. I beg you, I implore you. Don't push. Don't push. Don't push.
No, no, no, no.
Kill me.

No, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no, no.
I'm not ready. I'm not ready. I'm not ready.
You're going to be the death of me; you’re almost there.
It is you.
No, no, no. Just listen to me now.
I know, I know, I know. Let me catch my breath. Let me catch my breath.
Woo hoo hoo.

Laugh, laugh, you’re so funny, you, this, this, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t.
Father
Right, I bought you a ticket to experience something thrilling.
Alright, the safety rope is ready for you now. Close your eyes and jump straight down—it's incredibly thrilling; I’ve done it myself countless times.
Tickets purchased, come on over.
I didn't sign a contract. I didn't sign a contract. No, no, no. Could you…?
What are you afraid of? How old are you, anyway? You're making people laugh at you.
Do not look down; look straight ahead.
Do not look down, look forward.

Wait, wait, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t.
Don't move, don't move, don't move. Wait a moment, I'll get my phone and take a picture of you in this situation.
Alas.
What are you afraid of? Get ready, get ready. Close your eyes. I'm about to steal some grain.
Are you laughing so hard that you didn't even notice the people beside you laughing at you?
Could you please hurry up? There are many people waiting behind you.
Don’t laugh, you’re all the same.
Highly stimulating.
First, allow yourself to contemplate for a moment. Do not proceed further; first, contemplate.
Now, give the clown something particularly cute. Ready, ready?
Smile, smile, you're so amusing. You shouldn’t read any further now. I just couldn’t go on.

You can drop it.
You go ahead.
You.
That's quite good, it's singing, after all.
Oh, indeed.
Isn't it then, then, was it taken out?
Juanjuan went in.
It's not that time of year anymore.
Isn't it still possible to connect it?
What then should we do?
What are we going to do? It just happened like that. Will I still be able to work in the future?
Good, but not Gang brother.
I don't think you should go to Gang Ge’s workplace; it’s far too frightening. What if one day, you have an accident?
Gang Ge, look at you. I want to see such a Gang Ge. I want to see a whole, healthy Gang Ge.
Very well, that is acceptable.
Listen, I have something to tell you. I know you're timid, but this is a fact. Within our factory…
Am I not working at the cardboard factory?
Ah, yesterday.
Regarding my single employee.
Oh, it’s a colleague of mine.
Proper operation
Alas, the robot, weighing over three tons, crushed his hand.
He operated it improperly and forgot to turn off the power.
As he pushed the cardboard box inward, he turned the box as he pushed it forward, until the box had completely passed through.
Guess what happened.
He was turning around when…
The work uniform he was wearing.
Directly, unintentionally touching the machine and squeezing it.

在研究机器学习算法时，理解偏差和方差至关重要。偏差衡量的是模型预测值与真实值之间的平均差异，反映了模型捕捉数据潜在模式的能力。方差衡量的是模型预测值在不同训练数据集上的波动程度，反映了模型对训练数据中的噪声的敏感度。

高偏差的模型通常欠拟合数据，无法准确捕捉数据中的模式，导致预测误差大。高方差的模型通常过拟合数据，对训练数据过于敏感，导致在未见过的数据上表现不佳。

理想的模型应该在偏差和方差之间取得平衡，既能准确捕捉数据中的模式，又能避免对噪声过于敏感。正则化、交叉验证等技术可以帮助我们减少过拟合，从而降低方差。同时，选择更复杂的模型或增加训练数据可以帮助我们减少欠拟合，从而降低偏差。

偏差和方差的权衡是一个核心概念，需要我们在模型选择和优化过程中仔细考虑。
In the study of machine learning algorithms, understanding bias and variance is crucial. Bias measures the average difference between a model’s predictions and the true values, reflecting the model’s ability to capture the underlying patterns in the data. Variance measures the degree of fluctuation in a model’s predictions across different training datasets, reflecting the model’s sensitivity to noise in the training data.

Models with high bias typically underfit the data, failing to accurately capture the patterns within the data, resulting in large prediction errors. Models with high variance typically overfit the data, being overly sensitive to the training data and performing poorly on unseen data.

The ideal model should strike a balance between bias and variance, accurately capturing the underlying patterns in the data while avoiding excessive sensitivity to noise. Techniques such as regularization and cross-validation can help us reduce overfitting, thereby lowering variance. Simultaneously, selecting more complex models or increasing the training data can help us reduce underfitting, thereby lowering bias.

The trade-off between bias and variance is a core concept that requires careful consideration in the model selection and optimization process.
